Content:: Jacob Nena (10 October 1941 – 6 July[citation needed] 2022) was a Micronesian politician who served as the fourth President of the Federated States of Micronesia from 1996 to 1999. Nena served as Vice President under Bailey Olter; after Olter suffered a stroke in July 1996, Nena took over as acting president on 8 November of that year and was sworn in as president on 8 May 1997, serving out the remaining two years of Olter's term.[1] Before becoming vice president and president, he served as Governor of Kosrae from 1979 to 1983. Nena died in Sacramento, California on 6 July,[citation needed] 2022 at the age of 80.[2]  This article about a Federated States of Micronesia politician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
